doc.title: Berlusconi verdict: dancing carabiniere becomes YouTube hit
doc.author: Lizzy Davies
doc.description: Overexcited carabiniere in supreme court unleashed some dance moves that kept the waiting journalists entertained

main.p: If nothing else, Silvio Berlusconi might have expected that the only focus of attention at Thursday night's verdict reading would be him (albeit in absentia).

But even in that he was confounded. Just minutes before the entrance of the five judges who handed the former prime minister his first ever definitive conviction, an overexcited carabiniere in court unleashed some dance moves that kept the waiting journalists entertained and have now made him a star on YouTube.

Apparently unable to contain himself ahead of one of the most important court decisions in Italy's recent history, the officer, clearly feeling the anticipation in the air, performed a couple of quick white-gloved moves to the delight of the press corps. His inspiration appeared to be the Village People's YMCA.
To a group of journalists who had by that point been waiting in the court for more than seven hours, they will have gone down a treat.
